From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

descansar (first-person singular indicative present descanso, past participle descansáu)

  1. (intransitive) to rest (intransitive: take repose)
    Synonym: reposar

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of descansar
infinitive descansar
gerund descansando
past participle m descansáu, f descansada, n descansao, m pl descansaos, f pl descansaes

tu 		third singular

nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present descanso descanses descansa descansamos descansáis descansen
imperfect descansaba descansabes descansaba descansábemos, descansábamos descansabeis, descansabais descansaben
preterite descansé descansasti, descansesti descansó descansemos descansastis, descansestis descansaron
pluperfect descansare, descansara descansares, descansaras descansare, descansara descansáremos, descansáramos descansareis, descansarais descansaren, descansaran
future descansaré descansarás descansará descansaremos descansaréis descansarán
conditional descansaría descansaríes descansaría descansaríemos, descansaríamos descansaríeis, descansaríais descansaríen
subjunctive present descanse descanses, descansas descanse descansemos descanséis descansen, descansan

Derived terms

[edit]
  • descansu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “descansar”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “descansar”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From des- (“de-”) +‎ cansar (“to tire”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [dəs.kənˈsa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [des.kanˈsaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

descansar (first-person singular present descanso, first-person singular preterite descansí, past participle descansat)

  1. to rest

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of descansar (first conjugation)

gerund descansant
past participle masculine feminine
singular descansat descansada
plural descansats descansades

preterite descansí descansares descansà descansàrem descansàreu descansaren
conditional descansaria descansaries descansaria descansaríem descansaríeu descansarien

Derived terms

[edit]
  • descans

Further reading

[edit]
  • “descansar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “descansar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “descansar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “descansar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From des- +‎ cansar, literally “de-tire”.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /des.kɐ̃ˈsa(ʁ)/ [des.kɐ̃ˈsa(h)], /d͡ʒis.kɐ̃ˈsa(ʁ)/ [d͡ʒis.kɐ̃ˈsa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /des.kɐ̃ˈsa(ʁ)/ [des.kɐ̃ˈsa(h)], /d͡ʒis.kɐ̃ˈsa(ʁ)/ [d͡ʒis.kɐ̃ˈsa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /des.kɐ̃ˈsa(ɾ)/, /d͡ʒis.kɐ̃ˈsa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /deʃ.kɐ̃ˈsa(ʁ)/ [deʃ.kɐ̃ˈsa(χ)], /d͡ʒiʃ.kɐ̃ˈsa(ʁ)/ [d͡ʒiʃ.kɐ̃ˈsa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /des.kɐ̃ˈsa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /dɨʃ.kɐ̃ˈsaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /dɨʃ.kɐ̃ˈsaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /dɨʃ.kɐ̃ˈsa.ɾi/

  • Audio (Portugal (Porto)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: des‧can‧sar

Verb

[edit]

descansar (first-person singular present descanso, first-person singular preterite descansei, past participle descansado)

  1. to rest
    Synonym: folgar

Conjugation

[edit]

2European Portuguese.

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From des- +‎ cansar, literally “de-tire”.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /deskanˈsaɾ/ [d̪es.kãnˈsaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: des‧can‧sar

Verb

[edit]

descansar (first-person singular present descanso, first-person singular preterite descansé, past participle descansado)

  1. (intransitive) to rest, relax (be in a state of rest or inactivity)
  2. (intransitive, also figurative) to sit, to rest [with en ‘on something’]
    • 1939 July, Emilio Altamirano Sanchez, “De La Subrogación Real”, in Revista de Derecho Jurisprudencia y Ciencias Sociales, volume 47:
      Hecho ya el análisis de los postulados sobre los cuales descansa la doctrina llamada clásica.
      (please add an English translation of this quotation)
    • 2020 July 10, “Iglesias cree que “el debate sobre la utilidad de la Monarquía” crece pero ve difícil cambios a corto plazo”, in El País‎[1]:
      El vicepresidente segundo, Pablo Iglesias, ha asegurado este viernes que no se pueden desvincular los delitos de Juan Carlos I de su condición de rey y que la legitimidad de Felipe VI “descansa precisamente” en que es hijo del exmonarca.
      The second vice-president, Pablo Iglesias, assured this Friday that the crimes of Juan Carlos I cannot be disassociated from his status as king and that the legitimacy of Felipe VI "rests precisely" on the fact that he is the son of the former monarch.
  3. (transitive) to rest (put into a state of rest)

Conjugation

[edit]

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
